intro: Spergularia bonariensis, commonly known as the Argentine sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or arid regions. Its leaves are generally narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Spergularia bonariensis is also known for its ability to tolerate salt spray, making it a common species in coastal dunes.
